introduction: I'm a freelance facilitator and I provide training, advisory and policy advocacy services to businesses on sustainability, climate change, ESG, circular economy, and related topics. With 33 years of experience, I held roles in India as a CSO in the JSW Group, Principal Counsellor on Sustainability with India's apex industry body CII, and Manager - Sustainability with Procter & Gamble.
previous_positions: Principal Counsellor on Sustainability with CII (India's apex industry body)
major_achievements: Created the India Business & Biodiversity Initiative
Set up the green building movement in India
Co-created the world's 1st ESG index for emerging economies (S&P)
top_3_advice: Learn to unlearn. If you keep doing what you did, you will only get what you got!
Identify material aspects for everything, and channelise resources to them.
Review, measure and improve - in personal and professional lives
how_help_users: My diverse experience allows me to contribute as a content developer, trainer, facilitator, reviewer and be an agent of change. These can help me also be a 'king-maker'!
sustainability_journey: My interest in sustainability began from my graduate days while studying Ecology (optional subject), and thereafter pursuing post-graduate degrees in Environmental Science and then Environmental Engineering, ending with my Doctorate in Environmental Engineering. It taught me the the what and why (science) as well as the where, how and when (application), all of which are essential for sustainability.

academic_foundation.knowledge_gained: What and why (science) as well as where, how and when (application)

industry_experience_value: My stints in industry as well as in apex industry body gave me the experience and ability to train, implement and measure results, as well as analyse policies related to sustainability.
passion_statement: I've always nurtured a passion to create solutions that the masses can use and drive benefit from. The evolution of environment management, ecological services of nature, climate change and social development all converged into sustainability as we understand today. Or by its closely-related concepts of triple bottom line, or ESG.
